IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
During the month of December 2023, Master Trooper Hagan was contacted by Deputy U.S. Marshal Albert Maresca, here in further referred to as DUSM Maresca, of the United States Marshals Service. DUSM Maresca had received information about a person representing themselves as a US Marshal. Through his investigation, DUSM Maresca identified the subject as Anthony Kurt VALENTI, a white male with a date of birth of November 3, 1982.

DUSM Maresca’s investigation revealed VALENTI and a female had developed an online relationship which ultimately resulted in them exchanging phone numbers. Within these text messages, the witness communicated concern with VALENTI’s mental health. VALTENTI responded by claiming to be a first responder and stated: “I wouldn’t be a US MARSHAL and interpol if I was cray.” (A copy of the messages attached to this report). VALENTI also sent the female a photo of himself holding what appears to be a silver-star badge, like that worn by a Deputy United States Marshal, and another photo of himself wearing a flak jacket like body armor that a law enforcement officer would wear. During the correspondence, VALENTI text messaged: “I’ll let you wear my flack! And don’t be alarmed my call sign is “widowmaker.” (A copy of the messages attached to this report). It should be noted no date or time stamp for these text messages can be observed.

On November 1, 2023, Chief Velencia Marshal, Office of Compensation, Benefits, and Processing (OCBP), Human Resources Division, United States Marshals Service, confirmed the VALENTI is not employed with the agency and is not a Deputy United States Marshal. On November 1, 2023, Jason Bennett, Special Deputation Specialist, Physical Security Office, Office of Security Programs – Tactical Operations Division, United States Marshals Service, confirmed there is no record of the VALENTI ever serving as a Special Deputy United States Marshal.

Despite having an address of 11219 Lilac Lane, Perry Hall, Baltimore County, Maryland as being his address listed on his Maryland Driver’s license, through investigation it was determined VALENTI was living in a home owned by his mother and father at 9739 Morningview Circle, Perry Hall, Baltimore County Maryland.

 On October 24, 2023, law enforcement conducted surveillance of the 9739 Morningview Circle. VALENTI was observed sitting in the driver’s seat of a white van parked in front of the 9739 Morningview Circle. VALENTI was ultimately observed exiting the white van parked in front of the 9739 Morningview Circle and entering the home.  During surveillance, VALENTI was observed using a key to gain access to the 9739 Morningview Circle.

On November 6, 2023, VALENTI was observed operating a white 2013 Mercedes-Benz E-Class E-350 sedan displaying Maryland registration of 5AZ4000. This vehicle is registered to VALENTI’s mother, Gail Levinsky Valenti.

DUSM Maresca presented this case to his local Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) for search and seizure warrant and charging approval. This request was ultimately denied. Following this denial, DUSM Maresca reached out to the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division – Northern Region Investigators for assistance in this case. Master Trooper Hagan was ultimately assigned this case for investigation.

Since receiving this request for investigation, Master Trooper Hagan confirmed the information collected during DUSM Maresca’s investigation. Master Trooper Hagan was also able to confirm VALENTI is not an employee of Interpol as well.

On January 3, 2024, Master Trooper Hagan presented the facts of this case to ASA Matt Darnbrough, Baltimore County States Attorney’s Office. Based on the information conveyed, ASA Darnbrough advised he did not believe it raised to the level of police impersonation. However; ASA Darnbough did believe VALENTI was very close to crossing the line into criminality. While not recommending a search warrant be completed on VALENTI, he advised a consensual knock and talk would be advisable.

On January 5, 2023, at approximately 0845 hours, Master Trooper Hagan and DUSM Maresca responded to 9739 Morningview Circle to speak with VALENTI. The conversation stated with VALENTI at his door and Officers standing outside on the sidewalk. Officers were in plain clothes wearing outer vests with identification. VALENTI was asked to speak with investigators and agreed. VALENTI was notified of the complaint lodged against him. VALENTI initially lied to investigators and denied representing himself as a law enforcement officer ever. VALENTI has never been a law enforcement officer. It was not until showing VALENTI a photograph of him holding a U.S. Marshal Badge did he admit to representing himself as law enforcement. When asked about the badge, VALENTI stated it was in the house. VALENTI invited officers into his home and proceeded to the kitchen. The badge used by VALENTI was located on top of his refrigerator. VALENTI handed the badge over to Master Trooper Hagan. Master Trooper Hagan had the Badge inspected by DUSM Maresca. DUSM Maresca advised the metal badge is a convincing replica. VALENTI consensually forfeited the badge to Master Trooper Hagan. It was explained to VALENTI he did not have to forfeit the badge but willing did.

Prior to leaving, VALENTI was informed to no longer portray himself as any law enforcement officer. VALENTI was provided a copy of Public Safety Title 3 - Law Enforcement Subtitle 5 - Miscellaneous Provisions Section 3-502 - Impersonating Police Officer.

Master Trooper Hagan created and disseminated a MCAC bulletin as a situational awareness for allied agencies.

The recovered / forfeited badge was turned over to DUSM Maresca and documented on a MSP Form 67 (chain of custody).

Case Closed by Exception – Prosecutorial Denial.
